answers.answer: I'd call or go to get checked. Just because I have preeclampsia and extreme headaches are one of the signs. They say if you take an adult dose of Tylenol, basically two Tylenol, and the headache doesn't go away to go in to get checked. Good luck, hope you feel better!

When I get bad headache I drink lots and lots of water it goes away.My doctor says sometimes its just because we need to be drinking alot of water. 8 glasses a day.And honestly water helps.I have not needed to take any Tylenol so far I dont plan toGood luck as for back pain I'm getting it so it's not fun I just have my husband massage me it normally helps

I've tried the Tylenol but didn't doesn't work for me anymore cause I had to take them so much cause I use to suffer from headaches but haven't had any since my son was born but now they are coming back. I'll speak with my doctor all I do is drink water but lately I've been craving crushed ice. An for my back I tried having my fiance massage it but sometimes it makes it worse so idk I'll just have to call my doctor an see what she recommends me to do.

question: So for the past two days I've had an extreme migraine headache and I've been waking up with server back pains. I don't want to say the back pains are contractions cause it doesn't feel like it but I'm a little concerned that it could be I'm only 26+ weeks. Please help with any advice.
title: advice please
